title: Hobbies and Habits
content: I enjoy [swimming|to swim|swim|swam] in the ocean. I decided [to go|going|go|gone] to the park. He stopped [smoking|to smoke|smoke|smoked] for his health (quit forever). He stopped [to smoke|smoking|smoke|smoked] a cigarette during the break (paused to do it). I promised [to help|helping|help|helped] her. She finished [reading|to read|read|reads] the book. I look forward to [seeing|see|to see|seen] you.

explanation-en-US:
# üèä Hobbies and Habits (Gerunds vs Infinitives)

1. **enjoy + ing**: enjoy **[swimming]**.
2. **decide + to**: decided **[to go]**.
3. **stop + ing**: Quit an action (quit smoking).
4. **stop + to**: Pause to do something (pouse to smoke).
5. **promise + to**: promised **[to help]**.
6. **finish + ing**: finished **[reading]**.
7. **look forward to + ing**: 'to' is a preposition here.

title: Enjoy Running
content: I enjoy [running|to run]. She likes [swimming|to swim].

title: Want to Go
content: I want [to go|going]. He hopes [to see|seeing] you.

title: Avoid Eating
content: He avoids [eating|to eat] sugar. She finished [working|to work].

title: Decide to Stay
content: We decided [to stay|staying]. They plan [to visit|visiting].

title: Mind Helping
content: Do you mind [helping|to help] me? I miss [talking|to talk] to him.

title: Prepositions
content: He is good at [cooking|to cook]. Thank you for [coming|to come].

title: Promise
content: I promise [to help|helping]. She learned [to drive|driving].

title: Stop
content: He stopped [smoking|to smoke] (quit). He stopped [to smoke|smoking] (pause to smoke).

title: Suggest
content: I suggest [going|to go] home. He recommended [eating|to eat] here.

title: Need
content: I need [to sleep|sleeping]. The car needs [washing|to wash] (passive meaning).

title: Adjectives
content: It is easy [to learn|learning]. It is hard [to say|saying].

title: Too/Enough
content: Too tired [to walk|walking]. Strong enough [to lift|lifting].

title: Go
content: Let's go [fishing|to fish]. We went [shopping|to shop].
